snippet: With graduates facing a shortage of law jobs and mountains of debt, schools are being forced to rethink not just their economics, but also the way they teach.
abstract: Editorial calls attention to the crisis in legal education, and the fact that law school graduates face a shortage of jobs in the legal profession along with mountains of student loan debt; urges law schools to rethink both their economics and the way they teach.
lead_paragraph: With graduates facing a shortage of law jobs and mountains of debt, schools are being forced to rethink not just their economics, but also the way they teach.
